channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Rise, With Nasdaq Leading Gains
item.description: U.S. stocks rose, boosted by strong earnings from a key assembler of Nvidia and Apple products, plus a report that Donald Trump may tone down his tari...

item.title: Dollar Weakens Ahead of U.S. Labor Data
item.description: The dollar strengthened, but could fall sharply if the U.S. nonfarm payrolls report on Friday misses expectations, Ebury said.

item.title: Why DraftKings is betting on a subscription service that gives members improved odds
item.description: Paying consumers will have the ability to get better odds on their parlays for a monthly $20 charge

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Gain on Extended Cold Outlook
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures started the week higher with cold weather forecast to extend to late January.

item.title: Is any amount of alcohol safe to drink, in light of surgeon general’s cancer warning?
item.description: Surgeon General Vivek Murthy recommended that labels on alcoholic beverages be updated to include a warning about cancer risk.

item.title: Fed Vice Chair Michael Barr to Step Down
item.description: The Federal Reserve’s top banking regulator said he would step down from his position, but will stay on as a Fed governor.

item.title: Gold Futures Broadly Rangebound; Goldman Sachs Delays Gold Price Target
item.description: Gold futures dropped slightly, but prices kept trading in a narrow range. Goldman Sachs pushed back its estimate for gold prices to hit $3,000 a troy ...

item.title: Why bank stocks care that Michael Barr is stepping down as top Fed banking cop
item.description: Barr was leading the effort to raise capital requirements for banks.

item.title: ‘I’m rich beyond my wildest dreams’: I’m 66 and inherited $500,000. How do I make sure this money lasts?
item.description: “Should I buy an investment property? Stocks? CDs?”

item.title: Fed official delivers blunt warning on the stock market, which ignores it
item.description: Federal Reserve Gov. Lisa Cook gave one of the bluntest warnings an official at the central bank has ever delivered about the stock market.
